data.event: In 1745, a three-day battle occurred in Bellevue among the Shawnee, Miami, and Cherokee Indians, resulting in many deaths.

event.title: was named for the plantation of Gen. James Taylor Jr., Quartermaster General of the western U.S. Army in the War of 1812

data.event: Bellevue was named for the plantation of Gen. James Taylor Jr., Quartermaster General of the western U.S. Army in the War of 1812.
In 1848, his estate was valued at more than $4 million.
